description: This Java class 'KeypadDeviceShell' provides shell commands for managing MockKeypad devices within a testing or simulation environment. It includes methods for listing keypads, adding new keypads, and toggling or setting states such as tampered status and low battery. The class interacts with the core device registry through 'MockZigbeeCore' and likely used in conjunction with the Spring Shell framework for command-line interactions.

classes.name: KeypadDeviceShell
classes.description: Shell commands for manipulating MockKeypad devices, including list, add, tamper, and battery status functionalities.

classes.name: KeypadDeviceShell.NameValueProvider
classes.description: Inner class extending DeviceNameProvider to provide device names for Keypad devices within shell commands.

methods.name: list
methods.description: Lists all registered keypads, presenting their properties in a table format.

methods.name: addKeypad
methods.description: Creates and registers a new keypad with an optional custom name, defaults to incremental naming.

methods.name: tamper
methods.description: Marks a specified keypad as tampered.

methods.name: tamperRestore
methods.description: Restores a keypad's tampered status to normal.

methods.name: tamperToggle
methods.description: Toggles the tampered state of a keypad.

methods.name: lowBattery
methods.description: Sets a specified keypad's battery status to low.

methods.name: lowBatteryRestore
methods.description: Restores the battery status of a keypad to normal (not low).

methods.name: lowBatteryToggle
methods.description: Toggles the low battery status of a keypad.
